translated: Abhidharma-mahÄvibhÄá¹£Ä-Å›Ästra, fascicle 100
fifty-six
composed by five hundred great arhats and others
tripiá¹­aka master Xuanzang respectfully received
Are those dharmas associated with the unlearned correct thought?
Answer: One should make four statements.
Here, unlearned correct view can be obtained in all stages,
but not all uncontaminated minds.
Unlearned correct thought can be obtained in all uncontaminated minds, but not in all stages.
Therefore, one can make a great four-statement analysis.
There are dharmas that are associated with unlearned correct view,
but not with unlearned correct thought.ğŸ”½Namely, those associated with unlearned correct view and correct thought,
and those dharmas associated with unlearned correct view but not associated with unlearned correct thought.ğŸ”½Those associated with unlearned correct view and correct thought
refer to correct thought within the aggregate of unlearned correct view.
This is only associated with unlearned correct view,
but not with unlearned correct thought.
Because the essence of a dharma is not associated with itself for three reasons.
First, because two essences do not arise together.
Second, because past and future moments do not occur simultaneously.
Third, because dharmas do not take their own essence as a condition for themselves.
And dharmas associated with post-learner right thought but not associated with post-learner right view.
This refers to the intermediate state of concentration.
The upper three concentrations.
The lower three formless states.
Dharmas associated with post-learner right view.
This is not associated with post-learner right thought.
Because there is no right thought in those stages.
There are dharmas associated with post-learner right thought.
But not with post-learner right view.ğŸ”½This refers to the aggregate of right thought associated with post-learner right view.
This is only associated with post-learner right thought.
It is not the right view of one beyond training.
Because the essence does not correspond to the essence by three causes and conditions,
and it does not correspond to the right view of one beyond training.
The factors that correspond to the right thought of one beyond training
are those in the stage of access concentration and the first meditation,
and in the aggregates of the cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising.
They are the factors that correspond to right thought.
This is because the aggregate does not correspond to right view, as there is no right view in it.
There are factors that correspond to the right view and right thought of one beyond training.ğŸ”½Excluding the right thought that corresponds to the right view of one beyond training,
and excluding the right view that corresponds to the right thought of one beyond training,
the remaining factors that correspond to the right view and right thought of one beyond training.
In this aggregate, excluding the two essences,
the remaining mind and mental factors correspond to the two.
What are they?
They are the nine universal mental factors,
the ten wholesome factors of the great ground, the mind, and initial thought.
There are factors that do not correspond to the right view and right thought of one beyond training.
Namely, right thought not associated with the wisdom of post-learner.
Right view not associated with the thought of post-learner.
And the mental factors and dharmas not included in the above.
And form, the unconditioned, and the factors not directly associated with mind.
Right thought not associated with the wisdom of post-learner.
Refers to the thought in the aggregate of the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising.
This is not associated with the wisdom of post-learner.
Because there is no right view in that aggregate.
It is also not associated with the thought of post-learner.
Because the substance itself is not directly associated with itself.
Right view not associated with the thought of post-learner.
Refers to the intermediate dhyÄna.
The upper three dhyÄnas.
The lower three formless attainments.
The right view of post-learner.
This is not associated with right view.
Because the substance itself is not directly associated with itself.
It is also not associated with the thought of post-learner.
Because there is no right thought in that stage.
And the mind and mental factors not included in the above.
This refers to the intermediate state of the dhyanas,
the upper three dhyanas,
and the lower three formless states.
The mind and mental factors of the aggregates of the knowledge of extinction and non-production,
and all the impure mind and mental factors of the learners,
as well as form, the unconditioned, and the dissociated factors.
One should know that they are all included in the fourth statement.
The dharmas associated with the right view of the post-learner
are those dharmas associated with the right effort of the post-learner?
The answer is that four statements should be made.
Here, the right view of the post-learner can be found in all stages,
but not all pure minds.ğŸ”½The right effort of the post-learner can be found in all stages,
and in all pure minds.
Therefore, the four statements in the middle can be made.
There are dharmas associated with the right view of the post-learner that are not associated with the right effort of the post-learner.
This refers to the right effort associated with the right view of the post-learner.
This is not associated with the right effort of the post-learner.
Because the essence does not correspond to the essence itself.
There are dharmas associated with the right efforts of the adepts,
but not with the right views of the adepts.
Namely, the right views of the adepts and the dharmas not associated with the right views of the adepts.
The dharmas associated with the right efforts of the adepts.
The right views of the adepts.
Because the substance itself is not associated with itself.
The dharmas associated with the right efforts of the adepts but not associated with the right views of the adepts.
Namely, the dharmas associated with the right efforts in the aggregates of the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising.
These are not associated with right views.
Because there is no right view in those aggregates.
There are dharmas associated with the right views and right efforts of the adepts.
Namely, the dharmas associated with the right views of the adepts, excluding the right efforts associated with the right views of the adepts.
Because there are many right efforts, they are specifically excluded here.
However, in this aggregate, excluding the two substances, the other mental activities are all associated with the two.
What are they again?
Namely, the nine universal mental factors, the nine wholesome factors, the mind, and initial and sustained thought.
There are dharmas that are not associated with the right view and right effort of the post-learner.
Namely, the right effort not associated with the right view of the post-learner.
And the mental factors and activities not included in the above.
And form, the unconditioned, and the mental factors not associated with mind.
The right effort not associated with the right view of the post-learner.
Namely, the right effort in the aggregate of the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising.
This is not associated with right view.
Because there is no right view in that aggregate.
It is also not associated with right effort.
Because the substance itself is not associated with itself.
And the mental factors and activities not included in the above.ğŸ”½There are no other mental factors and activities of the post-learner not included in the above.
But there are all the mental factors and activities of the learner and the contaminated mind not included in the above.
And form, the unconditioned, and the mental factors not associated with mind.
It should be known that they are all included in the fourth statement.
As with right effort, so it is with right mindfulness, right concentration, and right liberation.
All of these can be made into the four statements in the middle.
All dharmas are associated with the right view of the adepts.
Those dharmas are not associated with the right knowledge of the adepts.
All dharmas are associated with the right knowledge of the adepts, those dharmas are not associated with the right view of the adepts.
Because these two dharmas do not arise together.
All dharmas are associated with the right thought of the adepts.
Are those dharmas associated with the right effort of the adepts?
The answer is that four sentences should be made.
Herein, the right thought of the adepts.
All impure minds can be obtained, but not all stages.
The right effort of the adepts can be obtained in all stages and all impure minds.
Therefore, the four sentences in the middle can also be made.
The text is like the right view being spoken in opposition to the right effort.
It is the same as in opposition to the right effort, right mindfulness, right concentration, right liberation, and so forth.
All dharmas are associated with the right thought of the adepts.
Are those dharmas associated with the right knowledge of the adepts?
The answer is that four sentences should be made.
Herein, the right thought of the adepts.
All uncontaminated minds can be obtained, but not all stages.
All uncontaminated minds can be obtained, but not all stages.
Therefore, one can also make a great four-part distinction.
The text is like the distinction between right view and right thought.
Are dharmas associated with the right effort of the adepts also associated with the right mindfulness of the adepts?
The answer is that one should make a four-part distinction.
Here, the right effort and right mindfulness of the adepts can be obtained in all stages and in all uncontaminated minds.
Therefore, one can make a small four-part distinction.
There are dharmas associated with the right effort of the adepts
but not with the right mindfulness of the adepts.
Namely, the right mindfulness of the adepts is associated with the right effort of the adepts but not with right mindfulness.
Because the substance itself is not associated with the substance itself.
There are dharmas associated with the right mindfulness of the adepts
but not with the right effort of the adepts.
Namely, the right effort of the adepts.
It is associated with the right mindfulness of the adepts but not with right effort.
Because the substance itself is not associated with itself.
There are dharmas associated with the right effort and right mindfulness of the stage of no-more-learning.
Excluding the right effort and right mindfulness of the stage of no-more-learning.
The dharmas associated with the right effort and right mindfulness of the stage of no-more-learning.
In this aggregate, excluding the two substances.
The remaining mind and mental factors are associated with the two.
What are they?
The nine great fundamental mental factors and the nine great wholesome mental factors, mind, and investigation and analysis.
There are dharmas not associated with the right effort and right mindfulness of the stage of no-more-learning.
The mind and mental factors not included in the above.
And form, unconditioned dharmas, and factors not directly associated with mind.
Here, there are no other mind and mental factors of the stage of no-more-learning not included in the above.
There are only all the mind and mental factors of the stage of learning and the contaminated stage.
This is not included in the above.
And form, unconditioned dharmas, and factors not directly associated with mind.
It should be known that they are all included in the fourth category.
As with right mindfulness, so it is with right concentration, right liberation, and right knowledge.
All of these can be used to make small four-part distinctions.
All dharmas that are associated with the right efforts of the adepts,
are those dharmas associated with the right knowledge of the adepts?
The answer is: four parts should be made.
Here, the right efforts can be obtained in all stages and in all minds without outflows.
The right knowledge can be obtained in all stages,
but not in all minds without outflows.
The text of the middle four-part distinction is the same as when right thought is discussed in relation to right effort.
The right mindfulness and right concentration are also like this.
All dharmas that are associated with the right liberation of the adepts,
are those dharmas associated with the right knowledge of the adepts?
The answer is: four parts should be made.
Here, the right liberation of the adepts,
can be obtained in all stages and in all minds without outflows.
The right knowledge of the adepts,
can be obtained in all stages,
but not in all minds without outflows.
The text of the middle four-part distinction is the same as when the right efforts are discussed in relation to the right knowledge.
Chapter on the faculties in the aggregate of roots, sixth of the sixth section on fish. If one possesses the eye faculty,
how many of the twenty-two faculties are accomplished and how many are not accomplished?
Such chapters,
and having understood the meaning of the chapters,
one should extensively distinguish them.
Question: Why is this section called fish?
Answer: Because it is difficult to grasp due to the frequent changes in status.
What are the many statuses?
They are the statuses of having faculties and not having faculties,
the statuses of having no gender, having one gender, and having two genders,
the statuses of having a mind and not having a mind,
the statuses of being in concentration and not being in concentration,
the statuses of the distinctions in realms, stages, and differences,
the statuses of severing wholesome [roots] and not severing wholesome [roots],
the statuses of being free from defilements and not being free from defilements,
the statuses of wholesome, defiled, and indeterminate minds,
the statuses of ordinary beings and noble ones,
the statuses of the path of seeing, the path of cultivation, and the path of no-more-learning.
In these statuses, the twenty-two faculties change and are not fixed in their accomplishment and non-accomplishment.
Because it is difficult to grasp like a fish, this name is established.
If one possesses the eye faculty,
among the twenty-two faculties,
how many does one possess and how many does one not possess?
The same question is asked up to the faculty of perfect knowledge.
The answer is: If one possesses the eye faculty,
one definitely possesses five, the rest are indefinite.
As for possessing five,
it refers to the eye, body, life, mind, and neutral faculties.
As for the rest being indefinite, it refers to the other seventeen faculties.
Either one possesses or does not possess.
It refers to the ear, nose, tongue, and body faculties.
If complete, then one possesses.
If incomplete, then one does not possess.
As for the female faculty and male faculty, if one has one sex, then one possesses one.
If one has both sexes, then one possesses both.
If one has no sex, then one does not possess either.
It refers to those who have never obtained them, or who have obtained them but gradually lost them at the end of life,
or who have lost them due to other conditions.
As for the faculty of pleasure, if one is born in the heaven of universal purity or below,ğŸ”½if one is an arhat born in the fourth meditation, then one possesses it.
If one is an ordinary person born in the fourth meditation, then one does not possess it.
If the faculty of suffering arises in the desire realm, it is accomplished.
If it arises in the form realm, it is not accomplished.
If the faculty of joy arises in the heaven of extreme radiance and below,
if noble ones are born in the third or fourth meditative absorptions, it is accomplished.
If ordinary beings are born in the third or fourth meditative absorptions, it is not accomplished. The faculty of sorrow is accomplished if one is not yet free from the defilements of desire,
if one is already free from the defilements of desire, it is not accomplished.
The five faculties such as faith are accomplished if one has not severed wholesome [roots],
if one has severed wholesome [roots], they are not accomplished.
The faculty of 'I shall come to know the unknown' is accomplished while abiding in the path of seeing, the others are not accomplished.
The faculty of 'I know' is accomplished while abiding in the stage of cultivation,
the others are not accomplished.
The faculty of 'I have known' is accomplished while abiding in the stage of no-more-learning,
the others are not accomplished.
Therefore, the others are said to be indeterminate.
As with the eye faculty,
the ear, nose, and tongue faculties are also like this.
They are all accomplished in the form realm,
but not accomplished in the formless realm.
because the desire realm is indeterminate.
If one possesses the body faculty, they definitely possess four faculties. The rest are indeterminate.
Those who possess four faculties
are the body faculty, life faculty, mind faculty, and indifference faculty.
The rest are indeterminate.
The remaining eighteen faculties may be possessed or not possessed.
If one possesses the eye faculty, they definitely possess the eye faculty.
If one does not possess it, they do not possess it.
The remaining seventeen faculties are as explained above.
If one possesses the female faculty, they definitely possess eight faculties. The rest are indeterminate.
Those who possess eight faculties
are the female faculty, body faculty, life faculty, mind faculty, pleasure faculty, pain faculty, joy faculty, and indifference faculty.
The rest are indeterminate.
The remaining fourteen faculties may be possessed or not possessed, as should be understood as before.
As with the female faculty, so it is with the male faculty.
If one possesses both the female and male faculties,
they definitely possess fifteen faculties.
Namely, the female and male faculties, body faculty, life faculty, mind faculty, five faculties such as faith, and five faculties such as tranquility.
They definitely do not possess three faculties.
Namely, the three pure faculties.
The remaining indeterminate cases should be understood as before.
If one possesses the faculty of life, they definitely possess three faculties. The remaining faculties are indeterminate.
The three faculties are:
The faculties of life, mind, and equanimity.
The remaining indeterminate faculties are:
The remaining nineteen faculties may be possessed or not possessed.
The eye, ear, nose, and tongue faculties are possessed if one is born in the form realm.
If one is born in the formless realm, they are not possessed.
If one is born in the desire realm, they may be possessed or not possessed, as explained before.
The body faculty is possessed if one is born in the desire or form realms.
If one is born in the formless realm, it is not possessed.
The female and male faculties are not possessed if one is born in the form or formless realms.
If one is born in the desire realm, they may be possessed or not possessed, as explained before.
The faculty of pleasure is possessed if one is born in the heaven of universal purity or below.
If one is an arhat born above, it is possessed.
If one is an ordinary person born above, it is not possessed.
The faculty of pain is possessed if one is born in the desire realm.
If one is born in the form or formless realms, it is not possessed.
If the faculty of joy arises in the heaven of extreme radiance and below,
if an arhat is born above, then it is accomplished.
If an ordinary person is born above, then it is not accomplished. The rest is as explained before.
The faculty of life, the faculty of thought, and the faculty of equanimity are also like this.
Because all sentient beings of the three realms definitely accomplish them.
If one accomplishes the faculty of pleasure, they definitely accomplish four. The rest is indefinite.
As for accomplishing four,
it refers to the faculties of pleasure, life, thought, and equanimity.
As for the rest being indefinite,
the remaining eighteen faculties are either accomplished or not accomplished, as should be known as before.
If one accomplishes the faculty of pain, they definitely accomplish seven. The rest is indefinite.
As for accomplishing seven,
it refers to the body, life, thought, and four feelings, excluding sorrow.
As for the rest being indefinite,
the remaining fifteen faculties are either accomplished or not accomplished, as should be known as before.
If one accomplishes the faculty of joy, they definitely accomplish five. The rest is indefinite.
As for accomplishing five,
it refers to the faculties of life, thought, pleasure, joy, and equanimity.
As for the rest being indefinite,
The remaining seventeen faculties are either possessed or not possessed, as should be understood from the previous explanation.
If one possesses the faculty of sorrow, they definitely possess eight.
They definitely do not possess one.
The rest are indefinite.
Those who possess eight
refer to the faculties of body, life, mind, and the five faculties of feeling.
Those who do not possess one
refer to those who possess the faculty of perfect knowledge.
The rest are indefinite.
The remaining thirteen faculties are either possessed or not possessed, as should be understood from the previous explanation.
If one possesses the faculty of faith, they definitely possess eight, the rest are indefinite.
Those who possess eight
refer to the faculties of life, mind, equanimity, and the five faculties beginning with faith.
The rest are indefinite.
The remaining fourteen faculties are either possessed or not possessed, as should be understood from the previous explanation.
As with the faculty of faith,
the faculties of zeal, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are also like this.
If one possesses the faculty of I shall come to know the unknown,
they definitely possess thirteen.
They definitely do not possess two.
The rest are indefinite.
Those who possess thirteen
Namely, body, life, mind, and the four feelings excluding sorrow, and faith and the others.
The faculty of I shall come to know the unknown.
Not possessing two means
The faculties of one who knows and one who has fully known.
The rest are indeterminate.
The remaining seven faculties are either possessed or not possessed, as should be understood from before.
If one possesses the faculty of one who knows, they definitely possess eleven.
They definitely do not possess two.
The rest are indeterminate.
Possessing eleven means
Life, mind, pleasure, joy, and equanimity,
Faith and the others,
And the faculty of one who knows.
Not possessing two means
The faculties of I shall come to know the unknown and one who has fully known.
The rest are indeterminate. The remaining nine faculties are either possessed or not possessed, as should be understood from before.
If one possesses the faculty of one who has fully known, they definitely possess eleven.
They definitely do not possess three.
The rest are indeterminate.
Possessing eleven means
Life, mind, pleasure, joy, and equanimity,
Faith and the others,
And the faculty of one who has fully known.
As for not possessing three,
it refers to the two roots of regret and the two roots of the uncontaminated.
The remaining indeterminate ones.
The remaining eight roots are either possessed or not possessed, as should be known as before.
If one possesses the eye faculty,
among the twenty-two faculties in the three periods of time,
how many does one possess and how many does one not possess?
The same question is asked up to the faculty of perfect knowledge.
The answer is: If one possesses the eye faculty,
one definitely does not possess the past and future eight,
namely the eight indeterminate faculties such as life, and only possesses the present.
Because their power is weak, they are not past or future.
One definitely possesses the past and future two and the present three.
The two past and future ones
refer to the faculties of mind and equanimity. One does not definitely possess these in the present,
because one may abide in a state without mind.
The three present ones
refer to the faculties of eye, body, and life. The remaining ones are indeterminate, as explained before.
As with the eye faculty,
the same is true for the ear, nose, and tongue faculties.
If one possesses the body faculty, they definitely do not possess the past or future eight faculties,
namely the life faculty, etc.ğŸ”½They definitely possess the past and future two, and the present two.
The two past and future faculties are
the mind faculty and the faculty of indifference.
The two present faculties are
the body faculty and the life faculty. The rest are indeterminate, as explained before.
If one possesses the female faculty, they definitely do not possess the past or future eight faculties,
namely the life faculty, etc.
They definitely possess the past and future five faculties,
and the present three.
The five past and future faculties are
the mind faculty and the four feelings, excluding sorrow.
The three present faculties are
the female faculty, the body faculty, and the life faculty.
The rest are indeterminate, as explained before.
As with the female faculty,
the male faculty is also the same.
If one possesses both the male and female faculties, they definitely do not possess the past or future eight faculties, and the three in the three times.
The eight past and future faculties are
the life faculty, etc.
The three in the three times are
the three pure faculties.
They definitely possess the past and future nine faculties,
The three times are two.
The present is four.
The past and future are nine, namely the four receiving, etc., and the five.
The three times are two.
The present is four, namely the male and female bodies, life, and the rest are indeterminate as explained before.
The Western masters say:
It should be said that in the past and future, ten are definitely accomplished,
namely the five receiving, etc.,
and one is definitely accomplished in the three times,
namely the mind.
Because the name is indeterminate.
The VaibhÄá¹£ikas of KaÅ›mÄ«ra say:
Although the name is indeterminate, the number is definite.
Because there must be one receiving present.
Here, the number is spoken of, not the name.
If one accomplishes the faculty of life,
one definitely does not accomplish the past and future eight,
namely life, etc.
One definitely accomplishes the past and future two,
and the present one.
The past and future two are
the mind and indifference.
The present one is
life.
The rest are indeterminate as explained before.
Like the faculty of life,
the faculty of thought and the faculty of equanimity are also so.
If one possesses the faculty of pleasure,
they definitely do not possess the past or future eight,
namely the life faculty, etc.
They definitely possess the past and future two,
one future,
and one present.
The two past and future are the faculties of thought and equanimity.
The one future is
pleasure.
The one present is
the life faculty.
The rest are indeterminate as explained before.
If one possesses the faculty of pain,
they definitely do not possess the past or future eight,
namely the life faculty, etc.
They definitely possess the past and future five,
and the present two.
The five past and future are
the faculties of thought and the four feelings excluding sorrow.
The two present are
the body and life faculties. The rest are indeterminate as explained before.
If one possesses the faculty of joy, they definitely do not possess the past or future eight,
namely the life faculty, etc.
One definitely possesses two in the past and future.
Those definitely possessing the past and future two are the two of intention and equanimity.ğŸ”½The two of the future are pleasure and joy.
The one of the present is life.
The two of the past and future are intention and equanimity.
The two of the future are pleasure and joy.
The one of the present is life.
The rest are indeterminate as explained before.
If one possesses the faculty of sorrow,
one definitely does not possess the past and future eight, and one of the present.
The eight of the past and future are life, etc.
The one of the present is the faculty of perfect knowledge.

analyzed: å®šæˆå°±éå»æœªä¾†å››ã€‚ ä¸‰ä¸–äºŒã€‚ ç¾åœ¨äºŒã€‚ éæœªå››è€…ã€‚ è¬‚å››å—ã€‚ ä¸‰ä¸–äºŒè€…ã€‚ è¬‚æ„ä¸€å—ç¾äºŒè€…ã€‚
translated: Those definitely possessing the past and future four are the four feelings.ğŸ”½The two of the three times are intention and one feeling.
The two of the present are body and life.
The rest are indeterminate as explained before.
The GandhÄras say:
This text should say one possesses five in the past and future,
namely the five feelings.
One possesses one in the three times,
namely intention and feeling, which are called indeterminate.
Therefore the KÄÅ›mÄ«rans say:
Although the names are not fixed, the number is fixed, so it should be explained as before.
If one possesses the faculty of faith, they definitely do not possess the past or future eight,
namely life and so on.
They definitely possess the past and future seven,
and the present one.
The seven past and future ones are
the mind, indifference, and the five such as faith.
The present one is life.
The rest are indeterminate, as explained before.
As with the faculty of faith,
the faculties of zeal, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are also like this.
If one possesses the faculty of future cognition,
they definitely do not possess the past or future eight,
two in the three times,
and two in the present.
The eight past and future ones are life and so on.
The two in the three times are
the already known and the fully known.
The two in the present are
suffering and sorrow.
They definitely possess the seven in the three times,
the three past and future,
the one future and present,
and the two present.
The seven in the three times are
Namely, the mind faculty and the five such as faith.
The three of past and future are:
Namely, the three feelings.
The one of future and present is:
Namely, the faculty of understanding what has not been understood.
The two of present are:
Namely, the body and life faculties. The two explanations here are as before.
The rest are indeterminate as explained before.
If one possesses the faculty of understanding,
one definitely does not possess the past and future eight,
and the two of the three times.
The eight of past and future are:
Namely, the life faculty, etc.
The two of the three times are:
Namely, the other two pure faculties.
One definitely possesses the past and future seven,
the future three,
and the present one.
The seven of past and future are:
Namely, the mind faculty, the faculty of equanimity, and the five such as faith.
The three of future are:
Namely, pleasure, joy, and the faculty of understanding.
The one of present is the life faculty.
The rest are indeterminate as explained before.
If one possesses the faculty of perfect knowledge,
one definitely does not possess the past and future eight,
and the three of the three times.
The eight of past and future are:
Namely, life and so on.
The three in the three times are:
Namely, sorrow, the other two, and the two without outflows.
One definitely possesses seven in the past and future,
Three in the future,
And one in the present.
The seven in the past and future are:
Namely, the mind, the faculty of equanimity, and the five beginning with faith.
The three in the future are:
Namely, pleasure, joy, and the faculty of perfect knowledge.
The one in the present is:
Namely, life.
The rest are indefinite, as explained before.
If one does not possess the eye faculty,
How many of the twenty-two faculties does one not possess and how many does one possess?
The same question is asked up to the faculty of perfect knowledge.
The answer is: If one does not possess the eye faculty,
One definitely does not possess one,
Namely, the eye.
One definitely possesses three,
Namely, life, mind, and equanimity.
The rest are indefinite, as explained before.
Like the eye faculty,
The ear, nose, tongue, female, and male faculties, and the three pure faculties are also like this.
If one does not possess the body faculty,
One definitely does not possess ten,
Namely, the seven physical faculties, suffering, and sorrow.
To be known and to be known as known.

Why do the Western masters
establish pride as an indeterminate faculty?
They say that the meaning of faculty is the meaning of firm and strong power.
Because the power of pride is firm and strong, it is established as a faculty.

Question: Why do the masters of this country not establish it as a root?
Answer: This is said to be the meaning of inferiority, which is the meaning of root.
Arrogance makes the mind elevated and not in accord with inferiority, so it is not established as a root.
Question: Why do the masters of this country establish non-defiled indeterminate wisdom as the root of non-defilement?
Answer: This is said to be the meaning of being the basis, which is the meaning of root.
Non-defiled indeterminate wisdom is superior as a basis, so it is established as a root.
Question: Why do the Western masters not establish it as a root?
Answer: They say that the meaning of firmness and strength is the meaning of root.
Non-defiled indeterminate wisdom has weak power, so it is not established as a root.
Question: Why do the masters of this country and the other country both not establish doubt as the root of non-defilement?
Answer: They both say that the meaning of definite abiding is the meaning of root.
Doubt does not definitely abide and turns in two directions, so
it is not established as a root.
According to this explanation,
just as there are three kinds of roots of goodness and unwholesomeness,
the roots of non-defilement should also be the same.

so too should indeterminate pride be.
The indeterminate roots are only three.
